cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 mi SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest Thursday and accelerating north-northeast toward the central Louisiana coast Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron–Pecan Island, south-central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Grand Isle, LA to Bay St. Louis, MS including New Orleans; also San Luis Pass TX to west of High Island TX; Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Watch from High Island TX to Grand Isle LA (west of the port); Storm Surge Watch from High Island TX to the AL/FL border including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas and Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas High Island eastward to the Alabama-Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible Friday with peak sustained winds 30–45 kt (35–50 mph) and higher gusts; hurricane-force winds unlikely but cannot be ruled out if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above ground level possible along the Plaquemines Parish coast and in adjacent bays Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals near 12 inches could cause flash, urban, and minor river flooding Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Swell-driven high waves and dangerous rip currents beginning Thursday; isolated tornadoes possible late Thursday night through Friday.
